The rapid change in symptoms over days suggests an active, possibly malignant process. The key features include splenomegaly and constitutional symptoms (weight loss, night sweats), which are characteristic of certain lymphoproliferative disorders or hematologic malignancies like lymphoma or leukemia, as well as infectious or inflammatory conditions that cause systemic symptoms. The rapid development of these features over days fits with an aggressive lymphoma variant, such as diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.  2.
